snippet: The story of the man who took the photograph of ironworkers having lunch high above Manhattan, and information about the Norden bombsight.
abstract: FYI column answers questions about Charles C Ebbets, photographer who took famous 1932 picture of ironworkers having lunch on a beam above Manhattan, and about World War II era scientific program for developing the Norden bombsight, a system for pinpointing a ground target from a bomber.
lead_paragraph: The story of the man who took the photograph of ironworkers having lunch high above Manhattan, and information about the Norden bombsight.
